alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Nelson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 04 at 5:14AM EST until February 06 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Louisville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... Rolling Fork River near Boston affecting Hardin and Nelson Counties. .Heavy rains from Thursday will continue to cause the river to rise. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Rolling Fork River near Boston. * WHEN...From early this morning to Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Agricultural bottomland is covered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 30.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 34.8 feet tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 33.0 feet. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding is possible and rivers are forecast to exceed bankfull. If you are in the advisory area remain alert to possible flooding, or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued late Friday morning.
